# Czerlin, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship

| subdivision_type1 = Voivodeship

Czerlin  is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Lubawa, within Iława County, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship, in northern Poland. It lies approximately  east of Fijewo (the gmina seat),  south-east of Iława, and  south-west of the regional capital Olsztyn.
The village was ceded to Poland after the East Prussian plebiscite in 1920.
